h1. Map Example
h2. Summary
This example shows how to cluster a Map using Terracotta. Note that the map used in this example is a java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap. As in standard Java, the ConcurrentHashMap structure in Terracotta is automatically locked, and requires no external synchronization.
If you use a java.util.HashMap, you will need to provide synchronization on your own. For more information on writing your own synchronization, look at the Synchronization recipe or the HashMap recipe.
h2. How to run
*Node 1:* {code} $ javac *.java $ start-tc-server & $ dso-java Main Enter name> Fred $ dso-java Main Enter name> Jane {code}
*Node 2:* {code} $ dso-java Main list Jane : Sun Dec 09 15:20:21 PST 2007 Fred : Sun Dec 09 15:19:50 PST 2007 {code}
